root.title: Razor Syntax
root.content:
Razor Syntax

Razor is a markup syntax for embedding .NET based code into webpages. It combines HTML markup with C# code. The syntax is designed to be compact, expressive, and easy to learn, enabling a fluid coding workflow.

quiz.question: What character is used to transition from HTML to C# in a Razor file?

directives.title: Directives
directives.content:
Razor Directives

Directives are keywords, prefixed with @, that provide instructions to the Razor compiler. Common directives include:

  • @page "/path": Specifies that the component is a routable page.
  • @using Namespace: Imports a C# namespace, similar to a `using` statement in a C# file.
  • @inject Type PropertyName: Used for dependency injection, providing an instance of a service to the component.

code-blocks.title: Code Blocks
code-blocks.content:
Code Blocks

The @code { ... } block is where you write the C# logic for your component. This includes properties, fields, methods, and event handlers that control the component's behavior.

@code {
private int currentCount = 0;

private void IncrementCount() {
currentCount++;
}
}

data-binding.title: Data Binding
data-binding.content:
Data Binding

Data binding connects UI elements to component data. Razor supports:

  • One-way binding: Renders a C# variable's value in HTML. Syntax: <p>Current count: @currentCount</p>
  • Two-way binding: Binds an HTML input element to a C# property. Changes in the UI update the property, and changes to the property update the UI. Syntax: <input @bind="@currentCount" />

event-handling.title: Event Handling
event-handling.content:
Event Handling

You can handle DOM events (like clicks or input changes) by wiring them to C# methods. The syntax uses an @ prefix followed by the event name.

<button @onclick="IncrementCount">Click me</button>

This calls the `IncrementCount` method in the `@code` block when the button is clicked.

control-structures.title: Control Structures
control-structures.content:
Control Structures

Standard C# control structures can be used directly in your HTML markup to conditionally render content or loop over collections.

  • @if / @else if / @else: Conditionally renders a block of HTML.
  • @foreach: Loops over a collection to render a list of items.
  • @switch: A switch statement for rendering content based on a value.
